Posts.Content: On Jun 04, 2014 10:32 PM kmoorerd wrote: Despite what appears in the media, the majority of women with breast cancer DO NOT HAVE A FAMILY HISTORY. As for soy consumption, remember that women in Japan have a relatively low incidence of breast cancer despite a high intake of soy. Often that correlation led to people being encouraged to increase their consumption of soy products. As a Registered Dietitian/Nutritionist; I would recommend a diet high in fresh fruits and vegetables, low fat dairy products and lean proteins especially fish high in omega 3s. If you prefer to be a vegetarian that it fine too. Just educate yourself. It is best to rely on "whole foods" rather than tons of supplements. If you can afford organics, go for it. On a limited budget? There are places on the internet where they list the top 10 foods to spend the extra $$ on for organic (like berries which you can't really scrub...) good luck and lots of healing energy for a quick recovery. Consider yoga as part of your recovery. Soy in Japan is not the same as the soy produced in America.  Most American soy is GMO, I believe about 90 percent of it.  Plus, the Japanese have a very different culture with lifestyle and diet.  Too many variances to make a comparison.  When I was diagnosed I had a well-intentioned friend bring up the whole Japan women and soy thing and suggested I eat a ton of soy to heal myself.  Yikes.
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: I drank tons and tons of soy milk starting just years prior to my diagnosis.  I also drank a lot of water out of plastic bottles.  My endocrine system got messed up and I started dealing with wicked hot flashes and perimenopause around my mid-30s.  I had a nurse tell me I was going through perimenopause and that phase can last about 10 years.  She mentioned it so flippantly like it's completely normal for someone in their mid-30s to have such serious and frequent hot flashes.  I also used a ton of cover-up type make-up, deodorants, etc. that have carcinogens and endocrine disruptive chemicals.  I loved cleaning with harsh chemicals and didn't bother wearing gloves - another endocrine disrupting experience.  It's no surprise I developed ER+/PR+ MBC.  And stress, terrible food habits, etc.  I was a mess.
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: I am stage IV BC and could use some advice for my next steps with the oncologist.  Spring Flowers, I believe you, yet it's so unbelievable considering the lack of hope for my case.  Now, it has not only gone to the bones, but liver and lungs in my case.  How do I (a broke, single woman who has to work full-time for a living) approach this next phase in my care?  I will not do the multiple chemos being pushed on me.  I had my port removed and it's not going back in.  And, removing my ovaries; how will that help? I just started the Budwig protocol and stopped cheating on my clean, organic eating.
Posts.Title: Looking for different perspectives on breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Spring Flowers, My cancer antigen was 1,278 in January.  Started Xeloda and combined a pretty heavy turmeric supplementation (per research done with those two in combo).  It went down to 601 in three months on just half a recommended dose of Xeloda.  Today at my appt. I found out it is 950.9.  I quit Xeloda and began budwig two and a half weeks ago.  I know, I know.  Everyone wants me to quit working but nobody will pay me to do so.  I did the disability route and as a consequence I was forced unto Medicare which added to my bills.  I'm alone with no support.  I did disability for a short time but it was barely enough to pay rent and groceries much less all the expensive natural remedies.  While I supplemented the disability with part-time work, they suspended me for working.  Now that I did the disability for a short time I was put on Medicare against my will and am not allowed to dis-enroll unless I want some penalties.  And the Medicare cancelled out my other insurance that I cannot go back on because of being Medicare eligible.  It's a mess.  My only hope is to get out of America.  Seriously being considered. Fortunately, my new oncologist is super sweet and not a bully.  She is thorough and a teacher.  She is still American standard of care, however, she wants to work with my naturopath and is disappointed that my insurance won't cover that.  I just got a call (as I type this!) from the naturopath physician about getting in to see her tomorrow morning!!  Talk about timing!  I originally had to wait until end of July and now with all these decisions and progression, I need her help right now! Along with quitting my job, I can't knock off any hours and have an "easier schedule."  I'm already broke.  I just paid my rent and nothing left for groceries or gas!  I asked friends to do fundraising for me but they are too busy with their families.  I went back to credit cards after being out of credit card debt and those are all maxed out. I don't know if I am just experiencing the worse before the better since I got very rigorous with the natural treatments and suddenly I progress like crazy.  But how far do I let it go before my spine is all eaten up and I'm wheelchair bound??  I don't know.  Lord, have mercy and heal me.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: As a former very resourceful social worker, I have looked every where for help.  Now I am making too much money.  If I lower my income just so I can get help, I will have to greatly compromise on my food sources, cut out most of my supplements, and stop seeing my naturopathic doctor.  I'm really okay working but it is frustrating that there isn't more help for someone in need.  Our welfare system gives too much to people who are lazy but capable of working.  It's a "normal" thing I'm doing by working and I am so blessed with this job.  I agree about these cancer research "charities."  I've checked on guide star and saw how much Komen pays their people.  Wow.  It's upsetting.  Here I am struggling and fighting cancer and they are reaping in half a mil for working at a charity.  Pink Ribbon Riders gives money directly to cancer patients and I have received a total of $1,000 from them since diagnosis.  They just don't have enough money to go around. I've heard of the asparagus "cure" and have wanted to do that.  I wouldn't use Green Giant or canned food though.  Can't I just buy asparagus and do the same?  I have a really hard time with the taste of asparagus but it is better than chemo.  I used to like asparagus so I'm not sure why even the site of it is now repulsive.   The Cellect supplement I've been taking the last two weeks have greatly increased my energy.  It's a powder that contains about 150 nutrients in one shake.  It's not the best tasting thing, but it's improving me health.  I see my oncologist in two weeks.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: The American system does not pay for anything outside the conventional standard of care. I was forced to take a government insurance that has limitations. Our insurances won't pay for hyperbaric treatment. I'm on my third hospital for oncologists and have done a lot of research to find a doctor. We have to pay out of pocket for natural treatments here. I don't have the time, money, or energy left to chase around all these natural treatments and I can't afford to go to another country for help.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: SpringFlowers, you are so wise! Turning to all alternative is not an easy decision for some.  I have been very discouraged by the lack of testimonies on sites such as these about their healing with alternatives (like Dochas said).   I think I would probably move on after my healing and not spend time on these sites.   I tried chemo one more time.  A "gentle" chemo which was so awful!  I'm done now.  I saw my oncologist a couple days ago and told her I need a three month break.  Yesterday, I went on a 25 mile bike ride with a friend!  It already feels so much better getting away from conventional!!   This week I'm doing a therapeutic essential oil protocol with sacred frankincense.  The detox is horrible today, but I actually feel cancer free. The pain is almost nothing (and I have "significant" bone mets).  Friday evening I will start Protocel.  I already have my first bottle but must prepare since almost everything I'm doing now will contradict the Protocel.  Plus, I want to make sure I follow it to a "T" so that I can have success.  I'm going to diary my progress on Elonna's corner and make sure I keep others looking for solutions updated.  I've seen too many people start talking about their alternative therapies and then they just seem to drop off the face of the earth.   Christ Beat Cancer is an excellent website full of information and testimonials.  That's a great place to start for anyone deciding to use alternatives.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Dochas, Spring Flowers and I are both stage 4 breast cancer. And, yes, I've tried coaching some women who decided lifestyle changes were too much and they only wanted to trust conventional letting the doctor make all the decisions. So I decided to just focus on myself. I do, however, agree that people don't follow up on their outcomes much. But, like I mentioned previously, a lot of these people turned to alternatives too late, have already been damaged too badly from conventional, and/or they didn't strictly follow the natural protocol. So they don't make it. People like Spring Flowers who start with natural and follow it are out there. I've seen a lot of testimonies elsewhere. Cancer compass is not the place to be to find these successes. There are books and better run forums like Elonna's corner (for Protocel users only) to find real stories and follow up.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: SpringFlowers, you are so wise! Turning to all alternative is not an easy decision for some.  I have been very discouraged by the lack of testimonies on sites such as these about their healing with alternatives (like Dochas said).   I think I would probably move on after my healing and not spend time on these sites.   I tried chemo one more time.  A "gentle" chemo which was so awful!  I'm done now.  I saw my oncologist a couple days ago and told her I need a three month break.  Yesterday, I went on a 25 mile bike ride with a friend!  It already feels so much better getting away from conventional!!   This week I'm doing a therapeutic essential oil protocol with sacred frankincense.  The detox is horrible today, but I actually feel cancer free. The pain is almost nothing (and I have "significant" bone mets).  Friday evening I will start Protocel.  I already have my first bottle but must prepare since almost everything I'm doing now will contradict the Protocel.  Plus, I want to make sure I follow it to a "T" so that I can have success.  I'm going to diary my progress on Elonna's corner and make sure I keep others looking for solutions updated.  I've seen too many people start talking about their alternative therapies and then they just seem to drop off the face of the earth.   Christ Beat Cancer is an excellent website full of information and testimonials.  That's a great place to start for anyone deciding to use alternatives.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I have definitely had my share of being bullied and, as a result, am now on my third oncologist since being diagnosed in the fall of 2011 (which of course was after two "nothing's wrong with you!" exams/mammo...whatever, they were wrong and I was the one to get sentenced with death). I've been doing all the organic/juicing/no GMO stuff, etc.  I compromised with sugar when doing chemo this year because I thought the drug would make up for it.  I drank half-caff coffee because I was so incredibly tired and falling asleep behind the wheel and at work.  I stopped all that self-destructive eating and got back on serious track.  Stopped the Xeloda.  Now, to have the discussion with my doctor tomorrow afternoon.  I do have an appointment with a natural physician the end of July...hate waiting but she was booked two months out for new patients.  I feel like I'm starting all over with worse cancer.  I just can't do the conventional stuff any more. Thanks for the response, Spring Flowers.  I'm looking into fucoidan.  I tried apricot seeds but didn't stay consistent with them.  I should try again and take them daily.  You also mentioned buying Honokiol.  Did that work?
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I'm calorie restricted and strict diet with help from my naturopath. And I'm not even going to depress myself by looking into more therapies I can't afford. I'm already considering a second job and what good is working around the clock and losing sleep trying to afford more stuff that's not helping?
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I agree with what Spring Flowers said. Even if the alternatives don't cure some people, they significantly increase quality of life and are helping people live well beyond their prognosis. It's worth it. Diet, exercise, and dealing with emotional burdens are the most important aspects in fighting cancer. Not drugs or chemo. And quite often people turn to alternatives after they've been nearly destroyed by the conventional treatments and sent home to die. Most alternative treatments don't work very fast. They are gentler and work slowly in helping a person regain their health. Quite often there's not enough time so alternatives are then erroneously considered a failure. Also, alternatives mean diligence and hard work by the patient. It's not merely popping pills or showing up for chemo. People who lack the discipline or refuse to take responsibility for their own health don't do well with alternatives.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Dochas, Spring Flowers and I are both stage 4 breast cancer. And, yes, I've tried coaching some women who decided lifestyle changes were too much and they only wanted to trust conventional letting the doctor make all the decisions. So I decided to just focus on myself. I do, however, agree that people don't follow up on their outcomes much. But, like I mentioned previously, a lot of these people turned to alternatives too late, have already been damaged too badly from conventional, and/or they didn't strictly follow the natural protocol. So they don't make it. People like Spring Flowers who start with natural and follow it are out there. I've seen a lot of testimonies elsewhere. Cancer compass is not the place to be to find these successes. There are books and better run forums like Elonna's corner (for Protocel users only) to find real stories and follow up.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: It is about two years later and hopefully some on this thread will be able to respond.  Many different supplements were mentioned that I have written down.  I am stage 4, ER+/PR+/Her2- and need to revamp my non-toxic therapy regiment.  After being on Xeloda I now have mets to liver (not getting them biopsied but showed up on a recent scan).  I was doing well with alternative care but was pressured to do conventional or lose my state insurance.  Yes, I had to do conventional or the state would discontinue my insurance.  Now I was forced on Medicare and not happy that I had no choice but maybe it will allow me better care outside the box. Can anyone chime in on how they are doing and anything else on supplements?  How are the supplements working? I see my oncologist tomorrow and she wants to add more drugs to the xeloda.  I haven't told her yet, but I stopped xeloda a week ago and don't want any more chemo.  I know it initially helped, but it made the cancer more aggressive and then stopped working.  Then an outbreak of tumors.  Chemo seems to stir up the cancer madness more than it helps plus does other harm.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Spring Flowers, Have you ever used or looked into Modified Citrus Pectin?  I've heard about it in the past but don't recall hearing about how it can help metastatic disease (or, better yet, prevent mets).  I saw a really terrific naturopathic physician yesterday who is having me take this.  Here's an unedited article about it.  The finalized version costs $39 so we just have to bear with any typos for a free version. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2782490/
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I have seen Forks over Knives.  Actually, I own the DVD.  Very good information.  There are a lot of people who have turned to non-toxic, natural therapies and experienced much better outcomes including healing.  I'm working on it.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: I checked Breast's activity log and am sorry to see it has turned negative and angry recently.  I am sincerely sorry and apologize if any of my comments add to your distress.  You're clearly going through a rough time which is totally undertandable.  I have MBC as well and am very familar with the pain and the horrible effects the hormonal tx make.  I hope the absolute best for you and blessings.  It can be hard to see that when our problems seems to escalate every day.  But there are a lot of positive things all around.  You have a husband.  That is wonderful.  Some of us have no one.  No one to help. No one to support.  And no one to cry to.  Be thankful for that and keep fighting.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: On Jun 20, 2014 5:26 PM Dlynn1210 wrote: It appears that the last time Emily posted was on February 23. I sent Emily a message asking her how she is doing and if there's anything she needs.  It's probably best that she doesn't come back to this posting with all the negativity and faith bashing popping up.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: On Jun 21, 2014 3:40 AM BreastCA4 wrote: Diane, So for you, the believe system- is it afterlife insurance? I am interested in the quality of life, one poster mentioned Satan.....amazing. When the post thread started, a serious question was posted "how do I help my friend" A earnest request, and that meant a truthful answer seemed in order,as a women who is in the same boat, fluffy, albeit well meaning- believe in God, falls short. I hope you not a stage 4 terminal patient, but I am. I recommended some legacy options and then being "present" for her friend. These are concrete "how can I help my friend".....listening, hand holding. This requirement to believe to get benefit, is your approach. Please don't assume it had any value to anyone else. In no other post has the god talk been present and so if you need to spread the good word, please go elsewhere. Please. When people are on here posting serious questions to a distressing situation, it's not appropriate to start turning on others offering help and support the way they know how.  Remember, this posting of Emily's is not about you.  It's counterproductive to turn it into an attack against other well-meaning people.  Don't expect everyone to think and feel like you do.  Everyone has the right to express themselves according to their beliefs.  If it's not fitting to you (which shouldn't matter anyway since this is NOT about you) then ignore it and move on.  There's no reason to pop in out of the blue just to attack someone else who is responding to the distressed person with kindness.  Please, learn some manners and cultural sensitivity.  It's rude to turn this into your problem and start policing the comments. Time to stop tracking this one.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: On Jun 19, 2014 4:06 PM BreastCA4 wrote: I am not sure if the last post is in the right thread. Stage 4 cancer is terminal. I have stage 4 and I am not deluding myself thinking GOD will provide a "cure", If that magical thinking is comforting to you, indulge yourself. I don't find any of that GOD crap useful, helpful or worth a second of my time. This is a real thread about dying, I doubt you have ill intent, but please take it somewhere else.Well, Breast, This particularly posting (from Emily) is not about you or for you. The decision about taking it somewhere else is Emily's decision. And, this post is NOT ABOUT DYING. It's about Emily looking for advice about her BFF's cancer diagnosis and how to help her. Being negative and attacking God is NOT helpful advice. Your comment is negative and not answering Emily's question. It's merely a satanic attack. You have absolutely no authority to tell anyone how they should respond. Sincerely, A friend of God
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: Right, Carolyn! If you're still alive, you're LIVING.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: Emily, You are a gem!  I wish you were my BFF in my fight against stage IV breast cancer with mets all over my bones.  Prayer is so important.   As of this week I will probably stop all conventional.  There is no medical cure and the treatments kill more MBC patients than it helps.  I just ordered a supplement called Cellect after talking to someone at their company for over an hour.  I suggest checking out www.cellect.org to just inquire about their product.  They provide free consultation and don't push you to buy the product.  I was in tears during my call because "Chris" listened to me and really built me up a lot.  I only called to order the product!  Cellect is a strong immune booster and could possibly be a great supplement to take during the immune killing treatments. I started on the Budwig Protocol a little over a week ago and will see how that goes.  At least it's not destroying me or making me sick.  Breath of fresh air... My heart goes out to you, Emily.  Your friend is so very fortunate and blessed to have you.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: On Jun 19, 2014 2:36 PM maithili wrote: On Feb 21, 2014 6:59 PM EmilyH wrote: Hi. My name is Emily and my best friend was diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic breast cancer last July that had spread to her bones.  She went through 6 rounds of chemo every 3 weeks and the PET scan showed no cancer! YAY!  She had a double mastectomy and partial hysterectomy (some of the tumors were estrogen-fed) on Jan 13 2014.  She went in for a body scan a few weeks later and they found more cancer under her arm.  They told her they would resume chemo followed with radiation for her bones.   Two weeks ago she went to the ER with severe headaches and back pain.  CT scan showed no cancer in the brain or vital organs.  They put her on pain meds, released.  Several days later she went back for severe headaches, loss of vision.  They did a spinal tap and her spinal pressure was very high and they removed 11 cc of fluid.  They also resumed chemo that day as her oncologist said that it was very important to jump on this NOW. We are supposed to find out if there are cancer cells in her spinal fluid today. I don't even know if I have a question.  We are both 35 - have been inseperable since we were in kindergarten.  Our children are close friends.  She has an 8 year old and a 6 year old.  I don't want to lose her.   I guess since I need a question... can anyone tell me a reason why her spinal pressure would be so high for a reason other than cancer?  Is there any hope?  Everything I have read says once it gets in the spinal fluid prognosis is grim. This sucks. -Emily God is in control.  I'm a BC survivor for ten years recently I have bone mets and in my spine and liver. I still work full time and have been on chemo.  Chemo combinations are not working now.  But I know he is in control.  I never wanted to share my story to anyone.  But I know that I am able to stay alive only because HE Lives and prayers.  My doctors are still optimistic and I manage with a healthy diet, juicing and eating one healthy meal. I'm glad she has a friend like you.  That is all she needs someone to talk to and pray with her. There has to be a cure.  I'm still searching and am hopefulMaithili, I'd love to hear your story and connect. I have a similar situation and will be deciding by next week if I will continue with any conventional. It just makes it worse...and working full time, running around to useless appointments, insurance hassles, side effects. If I keep going like this the tx and all it's stressors will kill me before the cancer does. My only hope is God, and I've been hitting the non-toxic therapies pretty seriously now. I tried to get three oncologists to allow me to do integrative care but it's their way or the highway. All three have even become angry toward me and seem frustrated with my questions/refusals of certain TXs. I can't keep battling the cancer industry, I have a cancer to fight and an income to earn. Emily, Someone before said this and I wholeheartedly agree - no matter what the prognosis is medically, treat your friend like a survivor. When my friends reacted like I was dying and wanted me to face that "reality," I became so depressed and wanted to give up. I no longer talk to those unbelieving friends who have refused to give me any hope. And the people who hang their head in sorrow around me are annoying. Treat your BFF like she's just like you and be very positive. Be her rock. It may be slim, BUT there is a chance of her being cured. Believe in that chance and help her to keep going. I have a friend I can call and cry about feeling like it's the end. She remains strong and will correct me. I can pick myself back up and keep going strong.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: On Jun 22, 2014 2:24 PM alicekay wrote: As a Christian I'm more than a little surprised at the harsh words and judgment toward Breast Ca4. This woman has terminal cancer and as Christians we should be showing her love, kindness and respect regardless of what she believes. I will pray for love and understanding. 1 John 4:7  Beloved, let us love one another, for love is from God, and whoever loves has been born of God and knows God.  Alice Kay, You are in error by extrapolating only what you want to believe in the word of God.  Read the entire word and don't deceive others by presenting only certain scriptures that "tickle the ears."
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: Just some examples from the WORD of God where Jesus addressed some people: Jesus answered them, Did I not choose you, the Twelve? And yet one of you is a devil (of the evil one and a false accuser). (John 6:70)  Note: Jesus was addressing one of his disciples whom He hung out with all the time. You are of your father, the devil, and it is your will to practice the lusts and gratify the desires which are characteristic of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a falsehood, he speaks what is natural to him, for he is a liar and the father of lies and of all that is false. (John 8:44) There are times in the WORD of God where Jesus says it like it is.  He didn't mince words.  He didn't prance around being Mr. Sunshine and everyone is okay because God is love.  He addressed the devil any time the devil was working through someone.  I know speaking of sin, of the devil, of God's just nature freaks out a lot of "Christians", but read your WORD and learn from Him.  Not just the lovey dovey scriptures - all of it. And, you can put down your stones now.  In your judgment of my words, you completely overlooked my post where I apologized and responded "in love" to Breast.  Breast has some issues that she is spilling out on cancer compass to intentionally attack others beliefs.  (I know.  I know.  We all have issues so I had no right to refer to hers. Sigh.) And, maybe you overlooked the part in the bible where Jesus chased people out of the temple with a whip and overturned tables.  There's a lot about Him we all tend to overlook because we want to see Him like we want to see Him instead of seeing Him as He is.  And, did you overlook the scriptures where John the Baptist called religious people a brood of vipers because they were coming to be baptisted by him?  Wow.  What a meanie.  He should have just told them how God loves them. And, Jesus rebuked his buddy, Peter, by saying; "Get behind me satan." Now, I will take the rest of my time to edify the believers and encourage unbelievers to be free from condemnation through Christ Jesus.  The truth is, the Lord loves Breast very deeply, but she has no love for Him yet.  It is in Christ where you are free from condemnation.  It is when you genuinely walk in Christ that you are free. Romans 8: Therefore there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus. 2 For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set you free from the law of sin and of death. 3 For what the Law could not do, weak as it was through the flesh, God did: sending His own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and as an offering for sin, He condemned sin in the flesh, 4 so that the requirement of the Law might be fulfilled in us, who do not walk according to the flesh but according to the Spirit. 5 For those who are according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh, but those who are according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit. 6 For the mind set on the flesh is death, but the mind set on the Spirit is life and peace, 7 because the mind set on the flesh is hostile toward God; for it does not subject itself to the law of God, for it is not even able to do so, 8 and those who are in the flesh cannot please God. I have been, even in tears, praying for Breast.  I care for her and I care about her eternity.  I'm not going to let her walk off a cliff just so I don't offend.  Her "God crap" comment and cutting down the person offering comfort in Christ was of the devil.  Plain and simple. Breast, I am diagnosed as terminal and you are as well.  The invitation is open to you to be free in Christ and live in eternity with Him.  He loves you and waits for you.  Turn it all over to Him.  Do not face death without knowing you will indeed spend eternity with Him. Please consider this.  Ask God if He is real.  He will show you.  Life here on earth has been tough, real tough; but it's in Christ where we can have peace and acceptance.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: I have stage IV BC and have been battling for over two years.  Don't despair.  I believe your wife can beat this thing.  chrisbeatcancer.com is a good website with loads of info.  He had colon cancer, but includes testimonies of others who had BC. The best thing I have done with great results was to clean up my diet.  I stopped eating processed foods, fast foods, soda, store-bought juices, etc.  I started juicing which is such a blessing.  Eat a lot of raw veggies, berries, seeds, nuts, no read meat or pork, small amount of organic chicken.  Drastically cut down carbs like breads and pastas (preferrably stop consuming them altogether).  I honestly think conventional treatment, especially Tamoxifen, screwed me up so I feel like I'm worse off and starting all over again in my fight.  And while I did conventional tx I cheated on my eating habits all the time because I believed the chemo would make up for my crappy eating.  Hmmm... Olive leaf extract is great for BC.  I just started taking it a day ago so time will tell.http://www.lef.org/magazine/mag2013/jun2013_Unexpected-Benef I just started the Budwig protocol and after one whole week I'm feeling a ton better.  I plan on starting with Cellect as soon as it comes.  www.cellect.org Young Living Essential Oils are amazing!  I wish I would have found them at diagnosis time.  There has been scientific research proving sacred frankincense's efficacy against breast cancer.  It must be therapeutic grade, not store-bought oils.  They also have oils to help with emotions, sleep, anxiety, and much more. Another really, really good source for diet changes iswww.hacres.com .  Rev. Malcom beat his colon cancer.  There's a lot of great info on his website including testimonials of those with BC. From my experience and research, don't just throw a bunch of supplements at her that promise to "cure" cancer.  Some of it can actually make the cancer grow, especially if she has estrogen positive cancer. There is not a one-shot deal with a supplement.  It will take some time for her to detox her body and get it in balance.  It will take patience and time.  I highly recommend finding a naturopathic physician who works with women with breast cancer.  Make sure they have professional skills with working with breast cancer! Chiropractic care is a good idea too.  Maybe schedule a consult to see what a chiropractor has to offer. And.. I've heard of baking soda, but not impressed.  I'm not saying it's bad or doesn't work, but I just don't think it will help (but I thought the same about Budwig protocol and I'm doing that now!).  Have not heard of Fucoidan.  If you use wormwood, you should do it under a doctor's care only. Lord bless you on this challenging journey! Carrie
Posts.Title: Wife with breast cancer, desperate to try any "natural" drugs

Posts.Content: Forgot to mention Gerson Therapy.  It is a very well-known non-toxic cancer treatment: www.gerson.org.  I use some of their concepts.
Posts.Title: Wife with breast cancer, desperate to try any "natural" drugs

Posts.Content: Spring Flowers, I would LOVE to have your information! It sounds like we have the same type of cancer. I'm at a crossroads with my tx and just now making a decision to stop all conventional after almost three years. I need a better plan. I've been doing the juicing, clean diet, a ton of research on natural stuff...I've done a lot. Maybe the conventional, and of course the stress, has gotten in the way of healing. Plus, I have a hard time finding others with the same cancer who have opted for the natural route and are doing well. Please send me info.
Posts.Title: Wife with breast cancer, desperate to try any "natural" drugs

Posts.Content: Spring Flowers, I would LOVE to have your information! It sounds like we have the same type of cancer. I'm at a crossroads with my tx and just now making a decision to stop all conventional after almost three years. I need a better plan. I've been doing the juicing, clean diet, a ton of research on natural stuff...I've done a lot. Maybe the conventional, and of course the stress, has gotten in the way of healing. Plus, I have a hard time finding others with the same cancer who have opted for the natural route and are doing well. Please send me info.
Posts.Title: Wife with breast cancer, desperate to try any "natural" drugs

Posts.Content: Thank you for posting the info about Jesicha's Hope!  I read her story just now and am in tears.  I have stage IV MBC, ER+/PR+/HER2-.  I would love to hear more about the support of your organization.  I'm alone in this fight, with a few solid frends from church, and am working hard to afford non-toxic therapies.  I've tried some conventional treatments but have been overprotective about my welfare (and finding that the doctors do not appreciate me saying "No" often).  I'd love to connect, please.
Posts.Title: Wife with breast cancer, desperate to try any "natural" drugs

Posts.Content: Rainy, You can fill out a fairly simple form for the FDA regarding the damages. I just did this for the Tamoxifen I took.  Doctors tend to ignore our cancer tx side effects and damage so I don't believe this stuff gets reported.  I feel I'm doing my duty for future patients and encourage all to report their serious side effects.  I don't know what happens after filling out that form.  I just filled it out and have to put it in the mail yet.  Go to the FDA website and search for reporting. Sorry, I don't remember the exact site.
Posts.Title: Liver damage after having radiation for breast cancer

Posts.Content: I thought mastectomy was to prevent the cancer from spreading.  So if it has spread, I would ask the doctor why they are doing a mastectomy.  I didn't and won't have one.  Our bodies already have so much work to do for healing and if a mastectomy is a wasted surgery, you're just compromising your healing.  If that's the case.   My doctor didn't do one after we realized it had already spread and scrapped those plans.  Doctors have a way of doing a lot of unecessary treatments. I always ask a ton of questions and never give a response to their treatment options until I'm fully comfortable and educated on it.  It has driven my doctor crazy, but too bad. It's my body. One of my doctors accused me of not liking her just because I told her "No" when she suggested a treatment.
Posts.Title: mastectomy with liver mets

Posts.Content: Lorraine, If at all possible, see a different doctor.  I'm on my third oncologist.  They miss things a lot.  And some are just doing their job and don't have time to care.   If you aren't getting the proper care, move on right away.
Posts.Title: re: answers help

Posts.Content: A good supplement for the liver is Standard Process Hepatrophin. My naturopath just prescribed it after mets showed up on my liver. It shouldn't conflict with any tx. She has had success treating someone with cirrhosis with Hepatrophin. They aren't cured, but it improved liver function. It is either sold at a supplement compounding place or through a naturopathic doctor's office. Milk thistle is another good supplement.
Posts.Title: re: answers help

Posts.Content: Not offended, Judith, but with stage IV breast cancer it is different.  Cutting off the breasts won't cure stage IV; the cancer will progress just as it wants when it wants.  A lot of doctors will just do it because they make money.  It's standard of care for these doctors, that's all.  And almost everyone I know who is stage IV now had a mastectomy prior to it metasticizing, so it's never a guarantee.  The exceptions are those who are diagnosed with stage IV from the start which most keep their breasts because it's too late.  Those who had mastectomies after a stage IV diagnosis generally did it out of a panic/fear..."get these things off me!"  They don't have a better prognosis and it's more of a burden on their health.  But it is always good to consult with two or more doctors on this before making a final decision if someone is telling you to have a mastectomy at stage IV.  Two of my oncologists understood this and did not opt for mastectomy.  We even cancelled the lumpectomy when we realized it was stage IV.  My third oncologist who throws everything and the kitchen sink at me demanded to know why I still have my breasts.  Some doctors just go overboard even though there is nothing medically speaking that will cure this cancer; only cause horrible and even life-threatening side effects and poor quality of life.  Those I have watched die after two years or less desperately tried everything their doctor would give them with no questions asked.  More is not always better.
Posts.Title: mastectomy with liver mets

Posts.Content: With metastasized breast cancer, it will flare up just the same whether you have a mastectomy or not. A mastectomy does not prevent or decrease progression. Being a surgery that takes a lot out of you and requires a lot of healing adds to your already complicated life. A mastectomy will not improve your chances with metastacisized cancer. It will add to your healing burden. It will add pain. It can also add a lot of agony if you have complications. Please get a second opinion and even a third if necessary. Patients often are mislead to believe that if you take care of the mother ship, you've taken care of the cancer. Please get a lot of MEDICAL advice about this. For a lot of breast cancer cases, mastectomy has only been the standard of care, NOT the best treatment for the patient. Being "radical" is actually NOT the best for quality of life and longevity. It's not a sprint, it's a marathon. Everyone I know who has lived the longest with metastasized breast cancer have not done everything being forced on them by the oncologist. Most of those who desperately went radical died within the 18-24 months generally given or less. That's how they came up with that prognosis. The ones who received all the "best" care available and became a statistic.
Posts.Title: mastectomy with liver mets
